ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: french grammatical skills and french culture/history
This class made me a much better french speaker and writer. Though everyday classes, I was able to use my french a lot and learn the language well.
I strengthened my grammar and reading skills.
My French improved exponentially this semester! In addition to strengthening my vocab and grammar, I gained practice engaging with French literature and film.
Speaking and writing in French
I developed my speaking skills and grammar. The wide range of literature aided my French reading ability.
Most notably, my listening and speaking skills in French improved greatly. I also improved my grammar.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: no weaknesses! course moved at right speed and very informational

The strength of the class was the fact that I was forced to use a lot of french and learn the language. We met everyday, meaning I spoke french everyday. The weakness was the course packet. This homework tool is simply out of date. The exercises were largely unhelpful, and the french department should consider changing part of the class. Additionally, there were too many assignments. There seemed to always be a test, quiz, or paper. In addition to the nightly homework (1-1:30 hours), the course was an overwhelming amount of work.
No improvement needed! I especially enjoyed working with the books and films.
It was a strength to have the whole class taught in French
Unnecessarily high workload. Teaching was very good and exercises in class were useful. It would be interesting to learn more about French culture.
I think one way this course could be improved is that the course packet and online listening modules are fairly outdated and is a little hard to use.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes i love french, my favorite class

Unless they were extremely passionate about the french language, I would likely not recommend this course. A lot of the homework felt like busy work, and the workload did not prove to be worth the return.
I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to improve their skills in French, especially their grammar skills
I would absolutely recommend this course to anyone who wanted to improve their French and start to get familiar with French culture.

Absolutely
It was a wonderful opportunity to immerse myself in the French language as well as gain a new understanding of French culture and grammar
Yes. It will help develop your French quite quickly.
Yes, I think it does a good job of building a foundation in French.
